info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Burke, southeastern Richmond, western Barnwell and southwestern Aiken Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Augusta Regional Airport, or 9 miles south of Augusta, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Savannah River Site, Plant Vogtle, Hephzibah, New Ellenton, Jackson, McBean, Augusta Regional Airport, Audubon`s Silver Bluff Sanctuary, New Savannah Bluff Lock & Dam Park, Savannah River Site Badge Office, Westover, Savannah River Site H Canyon, Bennock Mill, Miles Park, Savannah River Site K Complex, Richmond County Recreation Center, Shell Bluff, Shell Bluff Landing, Phinizy Swamp Nature Park and Redcliffe Plantation State Historic Site. This includes Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 8 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
